resources.string: Traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with rice, barley, salt and koji(malted rice).
Food prepared by coagulating soy milk and then pressing the resulting curds into soft white blocks.
Thick-sliced and deep fried tofu.\nWhile aburaage is conpletely deep fried, atuage is not deep flied well to remain tofu texture inside.
Dried, fermented, smoked, and shaved bonito.
Kamaboko is made by forming pureed white fish and steamed until fully cooked and firm.
Konnyaku is made by mixing konjac flour with water.\nIt is then boiled and cooled to solidify.
Basic seasoning for Japanese cuisine, made from a fermented paste of soybeans, roasted grain, brine, and koji mold. It is then fermented for about a year.
Dashi is a kind of soup and cooking stock which usually made from konbu, bonito, shiitake mushroom, and chicken.\nDashi is a cooking base of the Japanese cuisine.
Fermented soybeans which has slippery and sticky texture.
Collective term for edible algae and dried edible seaweed sheets.
Basic seasoning for the Japanese cuisine.\nSweet cooking rice wine made from distilled spirits, glutinous rice, and malted rice.
